thread.title: Janesville PD: Man accused of fleeing from officers
thread.title_full: Janesville PD: Man accused of fleeing from officers

author: @nbc15_madison
title: Janesville PD: Man accused of fleeing from officers
text: Janesville PD: Man accused of fleeing from officers MADISON, Wis. (WMTV) - A 28-year-old Janesville man was arrested Thursday on multiple charges including fleeing from police, Janesville Police Department reports. Police say officers attempted to pull the man over in connection to an ongoing drug investigation. However, police say the man refused to stop and fled from the traffic stop. After a vehicle pursuit failed, officers say they found the man had allegedly hit a vehicle at the intersection of E. Court St. and S. Garfield Ave. The man allegedly ran away but was taken into custody when officers arrived at the crash scene. The driver of the car that the man allegedly hit did not need medical treatment, police report. The man did request medical treatment and was brought to the Rocky County Jail after he was cleared from the hospital. Police say after the crash was cleared, search warrants were served on the 800 block of Milwaukee Street and 500 block of E. Court Street in connection to an ongoing drug investigation regarding the Janesville man. He was arrested and facing multiple charges including recklessly endangering safety. Police say he is also facing more charges in connection to the drug investigation.
